intro: Podospermum loreum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive velvety, hairy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
